title: Anime Tracker
summary: A full-stack application to help users track their anime watching habits, manage subscriptions, and receive notifications for new episode releases.
challenge: The Jikan API has strict rate limits that could impact user experience during peak usage or frequent searches
solution: Implemented a caching strategy using MongoDB to store frequently accessed anime data, reducing external API calls by ~80%. Added request throttling and queue management to stay within rate limits while maintaining responsiveness following the 80/20 rule
impact: Learned to work with external APIs including rate limiting, caching strategies, and error handling

title: Job Application Tracker
summary: A productivity tool designed to help job seekers manage their application pipeline, track follow-ups, and maintain organized records of their job search process
challenge: Job seekers often forget to follow up at appropriate intervals, potentially missing opportunities to demonstrate interest and professionalism.
solution: Implemented an intelligent timing system that automatically surfaces follow-up actions 3 days after the application date. Combined with email reminders and one-click template sending to reduce friction and ensure consistent follow-through.
impact: Practiced building intuitive UX patterns like context menus and automated workflows

title: Helhest Cane Corso
summary: A web platform connecting prospective dog owners with Cane Corso breeders, facilitating puppy adoption inquiries, and providing educational resources about the breed and responsible ownership.
challenge: Litters are born periodically, creating gaps where no puppies are available. Turning away interested families during these periods results in lost connections and potential adopters going elsewhere.
solution: Created an intelligent form system that adapts based on current puppy availability. When no litters are available, prospective adopters can submit applications to join a waitlist for upcoming litters, maintaining engagement and building a pipeline of pre-qualified families.
impact: Practiced implementing conditional business logic that adapts to real-world constraints and gained hands-on experience with cloud storage architecture (AWS S3)

title: Portfolio
summary: A recruiter-optimized portfolio website showcasing development work through video demonstrations and strategic presentation, designed to maximize engagement and communicate technical capabilities within the first critical seconds of a recruiter's visit.
challenge: Recruiters spend an average of 6-8 seconds on initial portfolio reviews. Traditional text-heavy portfolios fail to communicate value quickly enough, resulting in missed opportunities regardless of actual skill level.
solution: Designed a video-first approach where each project leads with a visual demonstration. Recruiters can immediately see working software and understand capabilities without reading lengthy descriptions. The 50/50 hero split ensures immediate visual engagement while maintaining essential context.
impact: Practiced content strategy and information design, learning to balance showing enough depth to prove competence while maintaining scanability for time-constrained viewers
